BBEX3.A.ERN.USD.CA.AB.A04: Exchange rates for the US dollar in Eritrea / USD 1 = ERN ... (selling)

General: On 8 November 1997, Eritrea ended its currency union with Ethiopia and adopted the nakfa as its own currency.  From April 1999 to November 2000, only mid-market rates were reported; see BBEX2:A:ERN:USD:CA:AC:A04.
Methodology: Calculated on the basis of month-end rates.
Comment on 1999: From April 1999 to November 2000, only mid-market rates were reported; see BBEX2:A:ERN:USD:CA:AC:A04.
Comment on 2000: From April 1999 to November 2000, only mid-market rates were reported; see BBEX2:A:ERN:USD:CA:AC:A04.

Comment on 2001: On 10 September 2001, the nakfa was devalued. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate).  7 September 2001: USD 1 = ERN 10.20 / 10.30  10 September 2001: USD 1 = ERN 13,55 / 13,80.  Calculated devaluation: 25.0% (middle rate).
